item.title: Two institutional addresses sold 25.5 billion PUMPs in one week and made a profit of nearly $40 million USD.On July 21, according to Ember, two addresses that participated in the institutional private placement of pump.fun recently made a total profit of $39.65 million in one week by selling 25.5 billion PUMP (about $141 million). Among them, the D6ar…Lazd address participated in the private placement with $100 million USDC and obtained 25 billion PUMP. In the past week, 13 billion PUMP (about $71.46 million) was transferred to FalconX and flowed to multiple exchanges, making a profit of $19.50 million; the 58WQ…v33E address obtained 12.5 billion PUMP with $50 million USDC, which has been transferred to the exchange, making a profit of $20.15 million. [PANews]

item.title: QCP Capital: Ethereum's performance drives the start of altcoin season, with institutions leading this round of gainsIn its market weekly report released on July 21, QCP Capital stated that multiple altcoin season indicators have exceeded 50, reaching their highest level since December of last year. Coupled with the open interest in ETH perpetual contracts jumping from $18.00B to $28.00B in a week, this marks the potential official start of altcoin season. QCP pointed out that the dominant force in this round of the cycle is institutional investors. Benefiting from the clarity in stablecoin regulatory frameworks brought about by the GENIUS Act, corporate finance departments have begun to increase their holdings of L1 public chain tokens such as ETH, SOL, XRP, and ADA, similar to the role of BTC in the fiscal allocations of Strategy and Metaplanet. If ETH obtains SEC approval for its staking spot ETF in the coming months, it may attract funds to shift from BTC ETFs to ETH, further unlocking yield potential. In fact, the daily net inflow of ETH spot ETFs last week has exceeded that of BTC for two consecutive days, showing a surge in institutional interest in ETH, and BlackRock is also confident in its staking ETH ETF. In addition, bullish call spread trading is active in the ETH options market, with large volumes of call spread positions being established for September and December expirations, highlighting the market's optimism for the fourth quarter. The current BTC market dominance has fallen from 64% to 60%, while ETH's market share has risen from 9.7% to 11.6%. If the trend continues, a new round of altcoin season may have begun. QCP stated that it will continue to monitor relevant signals and update developments as soon as possible. [Odaily]

item.title: Dynamix to merge with cryptocurrency firm to form Ether MachineOn July 21, according to the Wall Street Journal, blank check company Dynamix is preparing to merge with another entity to form a new company, Ether Machine. Sources said the merged company plans to hold more than $1.5 billion in Ethereum. Ether Machine co-founder Andrew Keys will serve as chairman. [PANews]

item.title: BigONE launches $8.1 million hacker bounty programOn July 21, according to BigONE’s announcement, in response to the recent theft of encrypted assets, BigONE has officially launched a hacker bounty program with a total amount of US$8.10M, calling on white hat hackers around the world to help track down the stolen funds and identify the attackers. BigONE said that it welcomes security experts to participate in promoting the recovery of stolen assets and the detection of cases. [PANews]

item.title:
Crypto investment products see record $4.4 billion in weekly inflows, pushing year-to-date total to $27B: CoinSharesGlobal crypto investment products attracted a record $4.39 billion of inflows last week, their strongest tally since CoinShares began tracking the data in 2014, and more than the previous $4.27 billion peak logged last December after the U.S. general election, the firm's head of research, James Butterfill, wrote on Monday.
The surge — the 14th consecutive week of net buying — lifted year‑to‑date inflows to $27 billion and pushed assets under management to a new all‑time high of $220 billion. Trading activity in exchange‑traded products also hit a peak, with turnover jumping to $39.2 billion.
Market leader Bitcoin was a primary driver of last week’s flows, but Ethereum was the star and notched a 13th consecutive week of capital allocations, according to Butterfill. Funds linked to the world’s second‑largest cryptocurrency pulled in $2.12 billion, nearly double their prior weekly record of $1.2 billion and taking 2025 inflows to $6.2 billion, already eclipsing last year’s total. Bitcoin products gathered $2.2 billion, down from $2.7 billion the previous week, but still sizable enough to keep overall flows at historic levels.
The United States unsurprisingly dominated geographically with $4.36 billion of inflows to funds offered by firms like BlackRock, Grayscale, and Bitwise, while Switzerland, Hong Kong, and Australia contributed a combined $78.7 million. Brazil and Germany logged modest outflows of $28.1 million and $15.5 million, respectively.
Among other altcoins, Solana, XRP, and Sui products attracted $39 million, $36 million, and $9.3 million, respectively, signaling risk appetite beyond the crypto’s two top heavyweights.

item.title: Degen adjusts liquidity mining rewards, Beefy rewards reduced to 1.25M, Aerodrome increased to 1.75MThe Degen token on the Base network will adjust the distribution of liquidity provider rewards: The daily distribution of Degen tokens on the Beefy platform will decrease from 1.50M to 1.25M; at the same time, an additional 1.75M Degen token rewards will be added to the Aerodrome platform each week to better balance the incentive mechanisms between the two platforms. [Foresight News]

item.title: BNB Chain Launches BEP-593, Introducing Weekly Incremental Snapshots to Improve Node EfficiencyBNB Chain is advancing the construction of more efficient node infrastructure. According to the BEP-593 proposal, BNB Chain will introduce a weekly incremental snapshot function to simplify the node synchronization process. [Foresight News]

item.title: OKX Wallet Launches PUMP Trading Arena with a Total Prize Pool of 18.00 Million PUMP TokensAccording to official sources, OKX Wallet has launched the PUMP Trading Arena, with the event running from July 21, 2025, 13:30 to July 28, 2025, 13:30 (UTC+8). During the event, users who complete specified trading, invitation, and sharing tasks will have the opportunity to receive rewards. The top 300 users by trading volume will share 12,000,000 PUMP tokens. The total prize pool for the event is 18,000,000 PUMP tokens. It is reported that Pump.Fun is a platform for creating and trading tokens, and PUMP is its official token. OKX Wallet is a leading one-stop Web3 portal in the industry, supporting 130+ popular public chains. [Odaily News]

item.title: Data: Hong Kong virtual asset ETF today's transaction volume is about HK$55.7922 millionOn July 21, Hong Kong stock market data showed that as of the close, the transaction volume of all Hong Kong virtual asset ETFs today was approximately HK$55.7922 million. Among them: The transaction volume of China Asset Management Bitcoin ETF (3042.HK/9042.HK/83042.HK) was HK$17.0465 million, and the transaction volume of China Asset Management Ethereum ETF (03046.HK/09046.HK/83046.HK) was HK$27.77655 million; The trading volume of Harvest Bitcoin ETF (03439.HK/09439.HK) was HK$1.2222 million, and the trading volume of Harvest Ethereum ETF (03179.HK/09179.HK) was HK$2.3379 million; The transaction volume of Bosera Bitcoin ETF (03008.HK/09008.HK) was HK$2.2717 million, and the transaction volume of Bosera Ethereum ETF (03009.HK/09009.HK) was HK$5.1413 million. Note: All of the above virtual asset ETFs have Hong Kong dollar counters and US dollar counters, and only two of Hua Xia’s ETFs also have RMB counters. [PANews]

item.title: BTFS 4.0 Introduces the Storage Provider RoleThe BTFS 4.0 network officially introduces the new role of "Storage Provider" to enhance the performance of the BTFS network, including reliability and long-term scalability. As core infrastructure nodes of the network, storage providers must meet stricter standards in terms of hardware configuration, online rate, and service quality, and must be certified by BTTC verification nodes. The plan aims to build a high-performance distributed storage network and promote the sustainable development of the BitTorrent ecosystem. [Odaily]

item.title: Thailand SEC proposes relaxing rules for testing crypto ICO investorsOn July 21, the Securities and Exchange Commission of Thailand (SEC) proposed to relax the knowledge testing requirements for retail crypto investors, allowing investors who have passed the test to be exempted from repeated testing, and changing the current quarterly retesting regulations to a suitability assessment every two years. The new rules require ICO portals to conduct comprehensive suitability testing on all digital token investors to ensure that investment risks match product risks. The proposal aims to reduce the burden on investors and ICO portals while being consistent with existing securities regulatory standards. The SEC is now open for public comments, with a deadline of August 1. [PANews]
